intro: Leptosiphonium gloeocalyx, commonly known as the gloeocalyx sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often in temperate regions. Its flowers are usually green or brown, and it produces small, triangular seeds. Leptosiphonium gloeocalyx plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland environments and supports local biodiversity.
